Uber for late at night close enough to be cheap.
reviews.negative: Definitely could have used a little mini fridge and possibly a safe. I managed to lock myself out one morning and there was no way of contacting anyone to get back in, but luckily someone Setting up saw me and let me in. My own fault really for having a brain like a sieve, but possibly a buzzer on their door would help. Picking holes though really. It was all great.

reviews.title: A beautiful, welcoming and friendly hotel/pub
reviews.author: Janet
reviews.tags: Leisure trip | Family with young children | Double Room | Stayed 1 night
reviews.positive: The food was outstanding, we had three courses in the evening which we thoroughly enjoyed, and the room was booked with breakfast and we had the full english, which again was outstanding. We struggled a bit to eat it, but only because we ate so much the night before! The room was large and inviting and the bathroom clean and sparkly. The outlay was well done, with stairs leading up from the corridor to a bathroom on the right and bedroom on the left. My sister was next door and she had stairs going down. All in all the ambience of the place was lovely and we loved that there were lots of rooms downstairs in the bar/restaurant area which made it feel cosy and welcoming.
reviews.negative: Absolutely nothing - everything was perfect in my opinion and I would highly recommend to everyone.

reviews.title: Hotel good, staff great, but no lift
reviews.author: Michelle
reviews.tags: Leisure trip | Family with young children | Family Room (2 Adults + 2 Children) | Stayed 1 night | Submitted via mobile
reviews.positive: We were here for a wedding, location was easy to get to with plenty of free parking available. The staff that I dealt with at every point were super courteous and helpful so thank you. The room was a good size and the bathroom was good especially the walk in shower.
reviews.negative: Despite having booked the hotel more than 1 month in advance and having received numerous emails/texts about my upcoming visit, on the day of check in, we received a call from the central reservations team at 10:30am (check in starts at 3pm) to say yeah we don't have your family room do you need one? Well yes that's why I booked it, I said I could take a different room provided I could fit in a travel cot as I was travelling with a 3month old baby and had no choice as we had to attend a wedding that day, if I'd known sooner I could of tried to book elsewhere. Also it isn't made clear anywhere until I turned up that there is no lift so we had to lug the baby, travel cot and pram all up the stairs. The room/floor also slopes which makes placing items on the table slightly awkward. I just wanted to say however again the staff at the actual hotel couldn't have been more helpful however providing some tap water so I could make up the babies feeds.

It is a 'Steak-House' - our Waitress was very attentive, as it was our 'first-time' in a 'Miller & Carter' restaurant. On Sundays and Thursday they have a 3-course menu for £29.95; otherwise, 'a-la-carte.'

hotel.name: The Kings Arms by Innkeeper's Collection

reviews.title: A comfortable, pleasant stay in a good central location just outside Knowle on the canal side.
reviews.author: Lynne
reviews.tags: Leisure trip | Couple | Small Double Room | Stayed 2 nights
reviews.positive: We stayed 3 nights and had a comfortable stay. The room was advertised as a small double and it was small! For a 3 night stay - too small! It was clean and decor very good. The bed very comfy. We ate in the dining room for each night of our stay and the food was mostly good, staff friendly and efficient. The breakfast was a bit bizarre as there was only a cooked choice! No cereal, fresh fruit or yoghurt and no continental version. The cooked choices were very good in fairness. It’s the first hotel I’ve ever stayed in anywhere in the world offering a “good breakfast” but having no choice of cereal, fruit, yoghurt the basics of a “good breakfast”. The chef is on duty so no reason why not. On enquiry we were told “we don’t do that”! Overall though a pleasant stay and we would stay there again.
reviews.negative: Not having a cereal, fruit, yoghurt choice at breakfast. See above for overall comments. During our stay there were quite a few choices not available on the evening menu and it got worse on the second and third night! Staff were having to constantly apologise to customers. It was not the waiting on staff members problem who were taking the flack but a management problem with ordering and deliveries. The waiting on staff were very apologetic and very sincere and they should be credited for their loyalty. The same happened with the cooked breakfast. Good job we weren’t vegetarians! We did complain. It’s a real shame as the quality, presentation, menu choice is very good and variable until it’s not available!

reviews.author: Kirsten
reviews.tags: Leisure trip | Family with young children | Double Room | Stayed 1 night | Submitted via mobile
reviews.positive: Locality, free off-street parking at the back of the premises for customers. Nice clean room and friendly, helpful staff. Reasonably priced. Late checkout at 12pm is brilliant as some places you have to be up and out the door by 9-10am! Close to local bus stops/shops for bits and pieces needed and travelling. Easy to book meals/breakfast for duration of stay and staff are happy to offer alternative places to eat if nothing taking fancy off their menu. Would definitely visit again.
reviews.negative: The room was nice, slightly smaller than expected. The double bed was against a wall so only one side accessible and OH had to climb over/shuffle down the bed to get in/out. Also street facing so rather noisy. We found it got very hot during the night. Window is there to open for air (also got a child safety lock/restrictor on it) but then you have the noise from the traffic outside on the main road and people walking by on the street. Investing in AC for the rooms would be good, or decent tower fans especially in the summer when the temperatures are steadily climbing. I'd imagine summer months would be unbearably hot in smaller rooms like that. All in that was it really.

reviews.positive: The room was very clean, large in space, and the beds were very comfortable. We had a view out our window to the houses across the road, which doesn't sound glamourous, but it's better than the opposite rooms which would be looking into the hotel carpark. The barman who checked us in was very friendly and allowed us to keep our car parked there the following day once we had checked out, so we could enjoy Edinburgh during the day before our drive into the Scottish Highlands. The hotel itself is located half way between the city centre and Edinburgh International Airport, and is situated on a main road. This means, there's 4 different bus routes going into the city centre and the wait for each is no longer than 5 minutes. This makes the location very convenient.
reviews.negative: While shampoo was provided in the shower, soap was not. It was a little annoying having to open the shower door each time to pump some soap out of the bathroom sink soap bottle. Apart from that, nothing else was bad!

hotel.name: Toby Carvery Edinburgh West by Innkeeper's Collection

reviews.title: Thanks 'Team Toby'
reviews.author: Grace
reviews.tags: Leisure trip | Couple | Family Room (2 Adults + 2 Children) | Stayed 2 nights | Submitted via mobile
reviews.positive: The place is looking amazing since it's just had a major refurb. We already loved it here ( have been coming here for years) but were so impressed with all the work that's been done throughout the bar, restaurant and public areas. Bedrooms are really modern too now with new comfy beds and supersoft pillows which were a godsend as my only gripe over the years was that the beds were so uncomfortable and the pillows were lumpy meaning i woke up with aching bones, but not anymore. Everywhere is spotless, bright and freshly decorated. We honestly wouldn't stay anywhere else in Edinburgh as this place ticks all the boxes for us. It's also only 20 mins on the number 26 Lothian Bus into the Capital and the bus stop is right outside the front door. The lounge bar is so relaxing and cosy with a really nice ambience and a nice new touch is that they are dog friendly and have a little station set up in the bar with a basket of dog blankets and jars of dog biscuits 🐕 The buffet breakfast is spot on with plenty of choice and constantly being replenished. Staff are amazing, helpfull and friendly as always. We have never had a bad stay here and cannot wait to book up again. Thanks again 'Team Toby'

reviews.negative: Staff at reception were wonderful but Breakfast staff were miserable and unhelpful. Breakfast was just dire. Including us there were only 12 guests yet from ordering to getting the breakfast was nearly an hour. There was no cereals or fruit and yoghurt and the menu only had 5 items on and one of those was not available. Even after asking for a slight change to part of one of the breakfasts that was not done and both breakfasts were cold and dry. Fried eggs stuck together, solid and cold, sausage not edible and all other items cold. Suffice to say we didn't eat it. Giving a decent breakfast is not difficult and the final part of the stay sort of let the whole stay down.

reviews.positive: Comfortable bed, nice soft towels, good supply of toiletries, tea and coffee. Makes a stay much easier. Good shower.
reviews.negative: We've stayed before and been given rooms in a better position. This time we were given a room on the back overlooking the bins which was noisy, also the were pigeons nesting under the eaves continually cooing, so, a disturbed stay. No eggs for breakfast.
